original: Larsson, Per Axel Nikolaus, läroverksadjunkt, Norrköping, f. 6/12/85 i Västerås av trädg :konsul. Johannes L. o. Sofia Bodin. — Mo’g:ex. i Västerås 05, fil. kand. i Upps. 09, fil. mag. 13, pro vår v. norra latin i Sthlm 14. E. o. lär. i Skövde 09, Strängnäs 10, Örnsköldsvik 10-11, Falun 12-14, Växjö 15, Västervik 15-17, Västerås 17-18, Sthlm 18-19, Saltsjöbaden 19, Eksjö 21-23, Gbgs h. real vt. 24 o. ht. 25, Gbgs h. latin 24-25, Gbgs handelsinst. samma tid, Alingsås 26, adj. i Falun 26, adj. i tyska o. eng. v. Norrköp. h. a. 1. sed. 40. Resor t. Engl. 09, 22 o. 29 å statsstip., Tyskl. 14 o. 30, Frankr. 20-21 o. 22, Span. 21, Österr. 24.
translated: Larsson, Per Axel Nikolaus, school deputy, Norrköping, born on June 12th, 1885 in Västerås to gardener and consul Johannes L. and Sofia Bodin. Married in Västerås in 1905. Bachelor of Arts degree from Uppsala University in 1909, Master of Arts in 1913, acting teacher in northern Latin language in Stockholm in 1914. Temporary teacher in Skövde in 1909, Strängnäs in 1910, Örnsköldsvik from 1910 to 1911, Falun from 1912 to 1914, Växjö in 1915, Västervik from 1915 to 1917, Västerås in 1917-1918, Stockholm in 1918-1919, Saltsjöbaden in 1919, Eksjö from 1921 to 1923, Gothenburg Higher Real Gymnasium in spring 1924 and autumn 1925, Gothenburg Higher Latin Gymnasium from 1924 to 1925, Gothenburg Commercial Institute during the same period, Alingsås in 1926. School deputy in Falun in 1926, school deputy in German and English at Norrköping Higher School since 1940. Travelled to England in 1909, 1922, and 1929 on state scholarships, to Germany in 1914 and 1930, France in 1920-1921 and 1922, Spain in 1921, and Austria in 1924.
